skill.name: verification-before-completion
skill.description: Use when about to claim work is complete, fixed, or passing, before committing or creating PRs - requires running verification commands and confirming output before making any success claims; evidence before assertions always
skill.summary: Use when about to claim work is complete, fixed, or passing, before committing or creating PRs - req...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and behavioral instructions for AI assistants. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no external command execution. This is a markdown instruction document that enforces verification discipline.

content.value_statement: AI assistants often claim work is complete without running verification commands. This skill enforces evidence-based verification by requiring fresh command output before any success claims, preventing false completion reports.
actual_capabilities: Requires running verification commands before claiming tests pass
Demands fresh command output as evidence for all success claims
Prevents premature completion statements without proof
Validates build status with actual exit codes
Blocks satisfaction expressions until verification completes
limitations: Does not execute verification commands itself
Does not integrate with specific CI/CD systems
Does not provide custom verification commands for your project
Enforces behavior but cannot prevent all false claims

use_cases.title: Pre-commit verification
use_cases.description: Run tests, linters, and builds before committing code changes

use_cases.title: Bug fix validation
use_cases.description: Verify bug fixes by reproducing the original issue and confirming resolution

use_cases.title: Sprint completion checks
use_cases.description: Validate all acceptance criteria are met with actual test results

prompt_templates.title: Test completion check
prompt_templates.prompt: Are the tests passing? Show me the full test command output with the pass/fail counts.

prompt_templates.title: Build verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the build command and show me the exit code and any error output.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Reproduce the original bug scenario and confirm the issue is resolved. Show me the command and its output.

prompt_templates.title: PR readiness review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all PR requirements and verify each one with actual test results or build output.

output: I cannot claim completion until I verify. Running test suite: npm test
Test output: 42/42 tests passed, 0 failures, 0 skipped
Build output: Build successful, exit code 0
All verification complete. Feature is ready with test and build evidence.

best_practices: Always run the full verification command fresh when claiming success
Read the complete output including exit codes and failure counts
Report actual status with evidence rather than assumptions
anti_patterns: Claiming tests pass without running the test command
Saying work looks correct without verification output
Trusting agent success reports without independent verification

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. Applies to any AI coding assistant that can run shell commands.

faq.question: Does this skill run tests automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill instructs the AI to run verification commands, but the AI must actually execute them.

faq.question: Can I customize the verification commands?
faq.answer: The skill provides a framework. You specify the relevant commands for your project such as npm test or npm run build.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no file access, network calls, or external code execution.

faq.question: What if tests are slow to run?
faq.answer: The skill requires verification regardless of time. Skipping verification defeats the purpose of the discipline.

faq.question: How is this different from regular testing?
faq.answer: Regular testing runs tests. This skill enforces the discipline of running verification before making any completion claims.
